name: Avocado Salad
ingredients: 1 tbs Red Chili Sauce with Shiitake mushroom
cooking_method: Put half avocado, bean sprouts and plum tomato in the plate
Add red chili sauce with shiitake mushroom on the avocado, add red chili oil sauce on the bean sprouts
Serve cold and enjoy!

name: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 chicken breasts, cut into small pieces
cooking_method: In a small bowl, mix together cornstarch, soy sauce, and chicken broth
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat.
Add chicken to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides
Add sliced peppers, onions, and garlic to the skillet and cook until vegetables are tender.
Pour the soy sauce mixture over the chicken and vegetables. Cook until the sauce has thickened and coated everything evenly.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt
In a large bowl, cream together butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy
Add eggs and vanilla to the butter mixture and beat until well combined
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, mixing until just combined
Stir in chocolate chips
Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown. Let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely

name: Chocolate Chip
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt
In a large bowl, cream together butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy
Add eggs and vanilla to the butter mixture and beat until well combined
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, mixing until just combined.
Stir in chocolate chips
Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown. Let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Shrimp Fried Rice
cooking_method: In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add shrimp and stir-fry until pink.
Push the shrimp to the side of the wok, and add beaten eggs to the center.
Scramble the eggs until just cooked, and then mix in with the shrimp.
Add peas and carrots, and stir-fry until the vegetables are tender.
Add cooked rice and stir-fry until heated through.
Add soy sauce, salt, and white pepper, and stir-fry for another minute.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Wonton Soup
cooking_method: In a bowl, mix together ground pork, shiitake mushrooms, green onions, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, egg, salt, and white pepper.
Place a small spoonful of the filling in the center of a wonton wrapper.
Moisten the edges of the wrapper with water, and fold the wrapper in half to form a triangle, pressing the edges to seal.
In a large pot, bring chicken stock, garlic, and ginger to a boil.
Add wontons and simmer until cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Hot and Sour Soup
cooking_method: In a pot, bring chicken stock, bamboo shoots, shiitake mushrooms, black fungus, and carrots to a boil.
In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with 1/4 cup of water.
Add the cornstarch mixture to the soup and stir well.
Add firm tofu, rice vinegar, soy sauce, and chili sauce, and bring to a boil.
In a bowl, beat the egg and slowly pour into the soup while stirring.
Add white pepper and stir well.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Kung Pao Chicken
cooking_method: Cut chicken breast into bite-size cubes and marinate with soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, cornstarch, salt, and Sichuan peppercorns for 30 minutes.
In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add chicken and stir-fry until browned.
Add peanuts, red and green bell peppers, and green onions, and stir-fry for another minute.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Ma Po Tofu
cooking_method: Cut soft tofu into small cubes and set aside.
In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add garlic, ginger, and Sichuan peppercorns, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add ground pork and stir-fry until browned.
Add fermented black beans, chili bean sauce, and shiitake mushrooms, and stir-fry for another minute.
Add soft tofu and gently stir until well combined.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Scallion Pancakes
cooking_method: In a large bowl, mix flour and salt.
Add boiling water and mix well with a spatula.
Add cold water and knead until the dough is smooth.
Divide the dough into 4 equal portions.
On a floured surface, roll out each portion into a thin circle.
Brush the surface with vegetable oil and sprinkle with chopped scallions.
Roll up the dough tightly into a cylinder.
Curl the cylinder into a spiral, tucking the end underneath.
Flatten the spiral into a pancake.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add a pancake and cook until both sides are golden brown.
Repeat with the remaining pancakes.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Kung Pao Chicken
cooking_method: Cut chicken breast into small cubes and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, hoisin sauce, corn starch, Chinese black vinegar, sugar, and salt.
In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add garlic, ginger, and Sichuan peppercorns, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add chicken and stir-fry until browned.
Add red bell pepper and stir-fry for another minute.
Add the sauce and roasted peanuts, and stir-fry until the chicken is fully cooked and the sauce is thickened.
Garnish with chopped green onions.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Hot and Sour Soup
cooking_method: Cut tofu and shiitake mushrooms into small cubes and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, Chinese black vinegar, corn starch, sugar, and salt.
In a wok or large pot, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add garlic, ginger, and Sichuan peppercorns, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add chicken stock and bring to a boil.
Add tofu and shiitake mushrooms, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the sauce and stir well.
Beat the egg and slowly pour it into the soup, stirring gently.
Garnish with chopped green onions.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Ma Po Tofu
cooking_method: Cut tofu into small cubes and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix chicken stock, soy sauce, chili bean sauce, Shaoxing wine, corn starch, and salt.
In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add garlic, ginger, and Sichuan peppercorns, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add ground pork and stir-fry until browned.
Add shiitake mushrooms and stir-fry for another minute.
Add the sauce and bring to a boil.
Add tofu and stir gently.
Simmer for 5 minutes until the sauce is thickened.
Garnish with chopped green onions.
Serve hot with steamed rice and enjoy!

name: Wonton Soup
cooking_method: In a small bowl, mix ground pork, chopped green onions, minced garlic, minced ginger, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and salt.
Place a teaspoon of the filling in the center of each wonton wrapper.
Fold the wrapper in half and seal the edges by moistening with water.
In a large pot, bring chicken stock to a boil.
Add wontons and cook for 5-7 minutes until the wontons float to the surface and are cooked through.
Beat the egg and slowly pour it into the soup, stirring gently.
Garnish with chopped green onions.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Kung Pao Chicken
cooking_method: Cut chicken into small cubes and marinate with soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, corn starch, and salt.
In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add dried red chilies, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add chicken and stir-fry until browned.
Add roasted peanuts and green onions and stir-fry for another minute.
Mix black vinegar and sugar in a small bowl.
Pour the sauce over the chicken and peanuts.
Stir gently to coat evenly.
Serve hot with steamed rice and enjoy!

name: Hot and Sour Soup
cooking_method: Slice pork tenderloin, bamboo shoots, and shiitake mushrooms into thin strips.
Chop green onions, garlic, and ginger.
In a small bowl, mix corn starch and water to make a slurry.
In a large pot, bring chicken stock to a boil.
Add pork, bamboo shoots, shiitake mushrooms, green onions, garlic, and ginger.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add rice vinegar, soy sauce, chili oil, sugar, and salt.
Stir in corn starch slurry and cook until the soup thickens.
Beat eggs in a small bowl and slowly pour into the soup, stirring gently.
Garnish with chopped green onions.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Ma Po Tofu
cooking_method: Cut tofu into small cubes and set aside.
Chop green onions, garlic, and ginger.
In a small bowl, mix corn starch and water to make a slurry.
In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add ground pork, green onions, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry until browned.
Add doubanjiang, chili oil, soy sauce, and Shaoxing wine, and stir-fry for another minute.
Add tofu and gently stir to coat with the sauce.
Add Sichuan peppercorns and salt.
Pour in the corn starch slurry and stir gently until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot with steamed rice and enjoy!

name: Honey Walnut Shrimp
cooking_method: Peel and devein shrimp, leaving the tail on.
In a small bowl, mix mayonnaise, honey, lemon juice, and salt to make the sauce.
Chop green onions, garlic, and ginger.
In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add walnuts and stir-fry until golden brown.
Remove walnuts from the wok and set aside.
Add shrimp to the wok and stir-fry until pink and cooked through.
Remove shrimp from the wok and drain the oil.
Add green onions, garlic, and ginger to the wok and stir-fry until fragrant.
Pour in the sauce and stir until it thickens.
Add shrimp and walnuts to the sauce and stir gently to coat evenly.
Serve hot with steamed rice and enjoy!
